other_tests.findings: Enlarged folds extending from the stomach to the beginning of the jejunum, with multiple nonbleeding erosions; evidence of chronic active gastritis.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Prominent folds throughout the stomach and duodenum noted in repeat upper endoscopy.

other_tests.findings: Biopsy specimens from the stomach and duodenum were negative for cancer, celiac disease, and eosinophilic gastroenteritis; indications of chronic active gastritis with nonspecific findings.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Subsequent biopsy from the duodenum revealed villous blunting, stromal edema, and scattered dilated crypts.

other_tests.findings: Prior colonoscopy revealed diverticulosis; repeat colonoscopy showed prominent mucus-secreting polypoid folds with intermittent erosions throughout the colon and terminal ileum.
Nodular and polypoid-appearing small bowel with erythematous and edematous mucosa throughout.
